title: Product of Cosines
text: Use the formula for the product of cosines to simplify. The formula is cos(a)cos(b) $$=$$ 1/2[cos(a-b)+cos(a+b)]

title: Substituting Angles
text: Based on the structure of the product of cosines formula, substitute the angles from the problem for a and $$b$$.

title: Identifying angle a
text: From the formula structure of cos(a)cos(b), what should the value of angle a be?

title: Identifying angle $$b$$
text: From the formula structure of cos(a)cos(b), what should the value of angle $$b$$ be?

title: Plug into Formula
text: To write the product as a sum or difference, plug in the identified values for the angles of a and $$b$$ into the formula.

title: Cosine Equivalence
text: Remember that $$cos(-x)$$ can be equivalently rewritten as cos(x).
